website_summaries.verdict: Space-saving design and cushioned tread belt. Connect your tablet to the treadmill and use iFit coach to store fitness statistics, and plot a route via Google Maps.
pros: 16-inch by 50-inch running deck is cushioned to provide comfort for extended periods and reduces impact on joints
An added option is that you can mount your tablet in the dock to view statistics with the iFit coach
Program routes via Google Maps, which can be displayed on screen
Thumb pulse sensors monitor heart rate
cons: Some users find attaching the base unit to the frame to be tricky and time-consuming

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! "SUBSCRIPTION" TO ACTIVATE THE MACHINE(MAKE IT WORK) WITH A CREDIT CARD!
customer_reviews.text: GOT THE PRODUCT ASSEMBLED WITH EXPERT ASSEMBLY FROM AMAZON.HOWEVER, WE COULD NOT ACTIVATE THE MACHINE(MAKE IT WORK) WITHOUT FIRST GIVING A CREDIT CARD NUMBER. WE ARE SUPPOSED TO "SUBSCRIBE" TO A SERVICE THAT I BELIEVE IS MONTHLY. APPARENTLY YOU CAN CANCEL THIS, BUT IT WAS AN UNEXPECTED PART OF THE PURCHASE. I PREVIOUSLY ORDERED THESE TREADMILLS WITHOUT SUCH A CATCH AND JUST STARTED USING THEM STRIAIGHT AWAY THIS IS A LITTLE DECEPTIVE, IN MY OPINION.WHY SHOULD I NEED TO GIVE A CREDIT CARD TO MAKE A MACHINE WORK? WRONG ON MANY LEVELS, IN MY OPINION. I WON'T GET ANOTHER PRODUCT THAT DOES THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 foot, 230 pound runner
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant after reading some reviews but at 6 foot and 230 pounds the treadmill works perfectly for my daily 40 minute runs. Steel frame, simple controls, good top speed, quiet, wide enough for just about anyone. It did not say this in the add but this model is iFit compatible meaning it has Bluetooth enabled.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to be able to walk in the colder months. This is not something a bigger person or someone looking to run would want. Brisk walk yes. Running, not recommended. It's small, compact and easily moveable. Would be perfect for an elderly person looking for a little excersize as the slowest settings are Extremely slow. No safety concerns there.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: deceptive practices
customer_reviews.text: They make you activate the console or the machine will not work. You have to use a credit card. I am sooo mad. This should be illegal. Do NOT buy this machine. I am actually going to contact the attorney general. I buy a treadmill and they force me to reveal my credit card in order to make it work. DISGUSTING welso!
customer_reviews.author: Bless The Lord

customer_reviews.title: They need to add instructions on how to start/run treadmill...
customer_reviews.text: When you first want to get it to work, press and hold the bluetooth button for 30 seconds. You should see it changed from "HELLO" greeting to a couple of bars/numbers. They didnt included this in the manual of course. Dont forget to register👍 Update: September 24, 2018, I checked my mail box and got a mail from manufacturer to extend my warranty up to 4 years for $59.99. LOL! I have not even receive a call back or email from them yet when I put in my service request the first day I got my treadmil when I couldnt figure out how to get it to run since it was not on the manual. Hahaha!
customer_reviews.author: Icould B. Anyone

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble and use, compact.
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Easy to assemble in 30 minutes. Sturdy. No louder than other home treadmills that I’ve owned. Love the compact size. No fear of it falling apart like many apartment size treadmills. Easy to start: if you don’t want the iFit application, simply turn it on and hold the Bluetooth button for 30 seconds and away you go. This is not in manual (it should be added). Don’t be scared away by poor reviews that were written by people who can’t follow this simple instruction.
customer_reviews.author: John LaCourse

customer_reviews.title: Nice treadmill! Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Nice treadmill! Easy to set up, folds up nicely. It even has bluetooth connectivity, which is rather surprising, as it was not advertised on the listing. Make no mistake, this is a cheap treadmill...however, so far it seems to be pretty sturdy and well built given the low price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy  May not run
customer_reviews.text: I received this tread mill put it together very easily 30 min or so. Pushed start button nothing happened. Pushed speed # button nothing. Now belt is still not running. Bought it for my grandson he is not happy. May try to return its kinda bulky or at this point may try to put a speed controller on the motor. If this doesn't work, Ill add it to my junk, because it is. I can't believe any on would sell this thing. Looks good mine doesn't run yet may have to rebuild.
customer_reviews.author: hobbslotus

customer_reviews.title: The treadmill arrived broken. I contacted the company for ...
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill arrived broken. I contacted the company for replacement parts thinking it would be easier to fix it than send it back. I've been waiting over 2 months for the replacement parts. I'm so frustrated because I thought it was a well priced treadmill, but it is actually just a broken mess.
customer_reviews.author: Somd3213

customer_reviews.title: HELLO screen.
customer_reviews.text: Just hold down the Bluetooth button for about 30 seconds. That'll start ya right up. YOU DO NOT HAVE TO SIGN UP FOR the iFIT anything! DO NOT! DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THEIR DOOP DOOP MEMBERSHIP!
customer_reviews.author: Pipsta

customer_reviews.title: Simply Does It ...
customer_reviews.text: I sold an elliptical machine in favor of this basic and simply treadmill. Having my hands free means I can flip through my iPad, read the news, surf Facebook and the 30 minutes of fast walking flies by. I couldn't get through 10 minutes on the elliptical before I was bored. This is just what I need, at 60 year old. Had some early issues trying to figure out the dashboard, but support clued me in to the changes since my manual was printed. I am ACTUALLY exercising three times weekly. Can't say better than that!
customer_reviews.author: crabapple

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: The order arrived sooner than expected. It is the perfect size, it has a good stability when you are using it but at the same time it is easy to move it to clean to floor or for temporary folding if you want to. It gives me the option to have the convenient speed level. Since l got it l am using it every day, in 50 minutes l get, 3.5 miles, at speed of 4.5 and l burn 400 calories, this is motivated for me.
customer_reviews.author: mmas

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could keep doing cardio in the winter without needed to join a gym. Works great and is easy to operate. Assembly was simple and only took about 15 minutes. I have enjoyed running on it. It is quite and smooth. I would recommend this to other people and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike RansomTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: won't stop charging my credit card!!!  Do NOT buy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Week I makes th our take if it to activate. The must have we your credit card number to activate and gives th ours free trail. Yet, I have emailed to n s of times. Called tons and they EVER answer! You are so we n t in circles with their mails. You can't cancel if it and they won't stop charging your credit card monthly! Don't order because of th u s issue. I never even used the if it. It was the only way I could activate the treadmill. Then you learn. I never used t he if it. They tell you to go online and change settings. That doesn't work either! Help!!! STOP CHARGING MY CREDIT CARD!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Will not start unless you give them your credit card and information (but can be bypassed)
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Entire scam is designed to sucker you into giving your credit card information and signing up for some kind of $15/month service. Attempts to contact their customer service are blocked until you give them a lot of personal information. The workaround: Hold down the "Bluetooth" button for 20 to 30 seconds, and the treadmill will unlock (and stop saying "hello"). I'd get my money back if it wasn't all such a hassle...I expect that's what the seller is counting on.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Product will not power up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present. Item arrived in a very abused multiple resealed box. No manual in the box but a pdf available so no worry and all the parts accounted for. Once decorations came down had room to set up treadmill, since assembly requires a bit of room and manipulation. Placing on side and elevating some parts to assemble. Once together and in location attempted to start up. None of the buttons on the console work. HELLO comes up briefly on screen then a line. Resetting, restarting, turning off/on, nor unplugging do anything. Wish I had just signed up with a gym because now I have a very useless very heavy monstrosity to get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Cali-kaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Confusing Set Up with iFit
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, you can't just assemble, plug in, and start using this machine. You are forced to activate it through iFit's website and you get a 1-month free trial. But then they charge you $15 a month! I don't think so! So we were forced to create an account on iFit, enter our credit card number, and activate our treadmill that way. Now we have to keep track of time and cancel the membership before the one month is up and HOPE the machine still works. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: LWlovesmyMan

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!!!! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is perfect for someone that just wants to walk more. Convenient and tells you the time walked, calories burned and the mileage. I just wish there it provided more info booklet
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: They bundle a scam/app with the machine
customer_reviews.text: They purposely do not list the instruction on how to start the machine, unless you go through their "activation" process. After researching here, it looks like the simple way to start the machine is to HOLD Bluetooth key while the RED MAGNET key is attached on the machine. WHY NOT simply describ this in your manual? The Activation process is way to get your personal information and prompt you sign up useless online fitness program. When call their phone numbers, both numbers do not get picked up by a human. However, the Amazon customer service is super! The stars are for them, not the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: ajp

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Arrived UPS in good condition.The usual ton of packing material but NO damage to product.Assembled by myself with little hassle.Note:When attaching the first bracket as instructed and it doesn't line up on one side after screwing in the opposite side loosen the large allen head screw on the rail. That will able it to line up as required. Performs as advertised.Satisfied with purchase.Would purchase again. This product cost me as much as having a repairman (person) fix the old one IF I could convince them to show up to my remote area.
customer_reviews.author: frankiez

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend just find something else
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to write reviews but on this i spent hours doing research and then got it didn't take long to assemble but didn't work just said hello tried calling the number no one answered so after a while I tuck it out side and broke it to pices with a slughammer so now its a smaller piece of garbage its up to you but I say no don't buy this .
customer_reviews.author: Jose hernandez jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill was super easy to put together, it's not terribly heavy either. We got it set up in about 45 mins! It is true that it will prompt you to set up iFit, HOWEVER if you hold down the bluetooth button for about 20 sec it bypasses the iFit step and you can start the treadmill no problems. The only thing that seems "cheap" about the machine are the stickers on each side of the screen, I was pulling the screen protector off and I almost pulled off the main visual stickers but I pressed them back down and there good to go. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: TLovas

customer_reviews.title: Treadmill Came Damaged and ONLY Works Via the iFit App
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the treadmill come busted up on the bottom (several areas of cracked plastic underneath the undercarriage, probably due to rough shipping), but it is also inoperable unless you go through the process of signing up for iFit. I wasn't aware that was a requirement for the treadmill to even work via Bluetooth. The setup was so counterintuitive, it just didn't make any sense. I contemplated returning it, but because it was SO heavy, I don't even want to go through the hassle. The unit is still operable for sake of the bottom cosmetic damage and I canceled the iFit membership. It only working via Bluetooth and the iFit app is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Watkins

customer_reviews.title: I will be contacting them
customer_reviews.text: So i assemble mines and i dont understand why the console dont work if i press any of the buttons it just makes a beeping sound and thats it. So my brother has the same treadmill i got his console installed on mine to see if it was the console and it was. I payed money for a treadmill without a console thats broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amare

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer’s customer service very poor
customer_reviews.text: We bought this treadmill to replace the other Weslo we had and loved. What we did not love was the fact that the treadmill won’t work unless you activate the IFIT option which costs money. However, we discovered that if you hold down the Bluetooth button for 30 seconds it will reset the machine and you can use it in manual mode. The manufacturer’s customer service is horrible and they wouldn’t help us. We had to figure this out on our own.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Get's the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: We needed a treadmill to run on while stuck in quarantine/social distancing for over a month but didn't want to break the bank as we have gym membership. This one had great reviews on Amazon and on Youtube. It totally does the job. It's not huge, and it doesn't have all the bells and whistles you're probably used to but it works like a champ and does not take up a lot of space. Would highly recommend if you like to walk or fast jog.
customer_reviews.author: Sip&Shop

customer_reviews.title: Good when it “runs”
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it for about a week and really want to love it. The app works really well with it... except when the treadmill just stops mid workout. The app will still be going and the machine is still on but it won’t move for 10-60 seconds. Kind of like a dog that decides it’s done running. It happened 3 times during my workout yesterday. I’m just glad I was only at 4.8 mph and not 7.8!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: The software was annoying for sure, but the product is stellar
customer_reviews.text: Running 7+ mph at 200 lbs demands a little bit from a treadmill, and especially from a low-cost fold up type. This thing is awesome! I won't re-hash the how-to for activation, but basically you just download the app and connect via bluetooth (see other reviews). I will say though, if you're taking out a credit card, you've made a wrong turn. It's annoying because there's "sign up at this website" crap plastered all over, and that is NOT how to activate it. Just get the app and the activation is absolutely painless with no credit card or membership required.
customer_reviews.author: Weston Winn

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Box came worn out,dented brackets and found a shipping label of someone else who I believe returned it because it wasn't working. We tried everything to make it work...went online for troubleshooting videos and read eveything online even went through the manual. We returned it and I hope amazon would be mindful of items that are returned and inspect for QC. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Grace and Rock

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a year and haven't used it as much as I could but it works great. I was able to bypass the trial subscription so no issues there. Very reliable. Be sure to oil it when it gets noisy. It can be a bit narrow for some people but if you plan on mostly walking (as I do) you can get used to it. I like the big holding space on top for my ipad while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great workout! Long belt for my 5’9” stride plus more room. Love the workouts that are built in. Cons: Not quiet, rather squeaky. Will have to get something for the belt. Not the easiest to put together, ran into some misalignment, but figured out where to loosen other areas in order to get the base together. I did do it by myself, so overall not too terrible to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Erin K

customer_reviews.title: A nice treadmill for the money
customer_reviews.text: A nice treadmill for the money. Would not recommend for a person over 150lbs. The frame is too light. Be careful when tightening screws-they will strip easily in the thin tubing. Otherwise, it's quiet and my wife is pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Collins

customer_reviews.title: Belt stops and slips
customer_reviews.text: Wish this treadmill worked for us. We previously had the weslo 5.9 before moving and then bought this “upgraded” weslo 5.9i for our new house and we’re having belt slipping issues when I run that I never had with the other treadmill and my husband can’t even walk let alone run on this treadmill or the belt stops for him (never did with the other treadmill). He’s 6’2 230lbs and was the same size when he ran on the other treadmill. This isn’t an upgrade - buy the original weslo 5.9 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Good treadmill, bad startup activation
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's a good treadmill once you can get the thing turned on. We set it up. That was all fine, took some effort to get all the screws lined up perfectly. When you go to turn it on, it won't budge until you activate the product online via bluetooth. That's would also be fine except they force you to give your credit card number and start a free trial with ifit, after which your card will automatically be billed $15/ month. You can cancel online at anytime, but its a whole lot of hoops to jump through just to turn the thing on. And there's no way around it, trust me i tried everything!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill for my wife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she loves it. I put it together and that was a piece of cake. She is 5' and absolutely loves it. She walks and runs and it meets her needs. It has the height adjustment with the adjustment of the legs up or down. This is a well made treadmill, not all the bells and whistles but you get a good, durable machine for a great price. You can't beat it for the price, I've looked. If you want fancy this is not for you, if you want effective and affordable, it's a great buy
customer_reviews.author: paracale

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned a treadmill so my basis for comparison is limited. Having said that, it was easy to set up & put together. I was concerned about that. I assembled it quickly & my daughter got it running without much trouble. Our whole family uses it. I am 6 feet tall & just over 200 lbs. No troubles. We’ve only had it a few weeks so I’m not sure about it’s longevity. But it seems to be solidly built without being too heavy or difficult to move.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey

customer_reviews.title: I Returned This Immediately
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in a ripped up box. We got it put together pretty easy but, once we plugged it in, the motor to the belt wouldn't work. We got the console to work just fine and it was counting up seconds like it's supposed too. Heck, I should have kept it because it said I was burning calories just standing there! Anyway, I am not messing with it. I don't want a repairman to come out for something that I just had delivered. I demand that anything I spend money on works out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: OUPalms

customer_reviews.title: Good till i kinda mess up and they wont help me at all cause warranty is so short
customer_reviews.text: It was good then months in it start making squeaky sound but i just ignore it. Then the left handle stick came loose which i took off the lcd screen to fix it and i accidentally broke one of the wire doing it. I contacted their support and they said i have to reorder it from them since my warranty is out of date.It would of cost me $159 to reorder one. Its more than half of what i pay for a new one. I had my treadmill for only 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Came with broken parts. Had to return all that and pack back.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Button worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about making such a large purchase online with some of the reviews saying "you need an app" "dead on arrival" "scam", but this treadmill works great for my needs!!! I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The Bluetooth button method worked for me to get my treadmill going. Just hold it down about 1 minute then you'll be walking in no time.
customer_reviews.author: JHDZ

customer_reviews.title: Would return if it wasn’t a pain
customer_reviews.text: Love the space saving aspect which is why I bought it, however I hate that you have to install an app and pay a monthly fee to use the treadmill. Should be a free service that comes with it. Also, the treadmill has been used only a handful of times but after about 5 minutes of 4mph it shuts off and I almost tweaked and fell, I’m only 205 lbs -.-
customer_reviews.author: Vince S.

customer_reviews.title: you must buy subscription to IFIT
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to assemble some parts must be calibrate before it could put all together once it has been assembled it is very hard to make the machine works and must buy subscription to the IFIT app in order to make the treadmill works, I learn how to bypass this required extra purchase in YOUTUBE other than that for the price the machine work very good and after I cancelled the subscription I am very happy and using it every day a little bit noise but tolerable and understandable ,tolerable for the price you are getting
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, it seems.
customer_reviews.text: I've used dozens of treadmills in gym settings, and the only thing I really can complain about is the noise. When running, anything over 6mph, it's like a whining sound. That's about it.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Update: used twice now won’t run, seems motor is locked up. Still no return call for the warranty. Quick delivery, easy assembly. If you have no physical restrictions, you can assemble this. Took about 40 min. Just arrived so haven’t had time to actually work out, but seems to be great for the money. Hold the blue tooth button for 30 seconds if you don’t want to use iFit and it will reset your screen to work without iFit. A little loud but nothing crazy. Would recommend and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic walking treadmill.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a basic treadmill - for a small elderly person like me - good for walking - to be used several times a day if wanted. Good price point for the features I wanted. Adequate cushion in treadway, several simple workouts. Can be connected to ifit if I want, but easy to bypass ifit if not wanted. I'm a small woman and I can manage moving it and opening and closing it by myself, once it was set up.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S Kenestrick

customer_reviews.title: Belt is very loud.
customer_reviews.text: Really excited to get this. Finally got it together and it would not start. Called and was told to hold down the Bluetooth button. Problem was solved within a few minutes. Wasn’t happy when I Worked out this morning and found that the belt his extremely Loud. Not sure how to fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrible treadmill sold me a defective product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is noisy sounds like it is broken from the first moment we started using it. I’m very dissatisfied thinking of calling BBB. I want it replaced or to return it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria smith

customer_reviews.title: You DON'T need to activate the treadmill.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and i was soooooo nervous about getting this treadmill. 1. It was super easy to put together 2. they provide all the screws you need 3. I didn't NOT have to activate anything *****I plugged it up, flipped the on switch, pushed the Start button, held the bluetooth button, it made a beeping sound, let go of the button and pushed the #1. Bammmm! We're walking😉 Hope this helps you !
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Pano

customer_reviews.title: Came with a bad wire! Belt doesn’t move when console turned on!
customer_reviews.text: Well I’m pissed! I ordered, received and assembled the treadmill just for it not to work! Don’t worry, it wasn’t the issue with activation. I did all that first (thanks to you all), but the belt however, doesn’t move when I start the workout! I had to call and I’m having a part shipped to me! This is very aggravating! How does a brand new machine come to me with a bad part?! If I had the patience to take it back apart, I’d send it back, but I don’t. I’ll leave a review on the performance once I get it up and running. I’m starting with a low rating just for this first inconvenience!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice home treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly. Assembly was fairly easy. Does go better with 2 people to support while aligning track to screw on base. Seems fairly sturdy. Working/turns on right away. (We did not register it as per some other reviews stating this then required assist). Don't expect this to be as good as a gym grade treadmill. I am a heavier person and notice some drag in the track. But it's working well so far- 1 wk. Will check back in a month....
customer_reviews.author: carole dewitt

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: While it is small, you should still be able to run on it. I'm 6' 200 lbs and I manage just fine. Aside from belt slipping almost every step I take... I would keep it and make it work. Running on this thing is a injury waiting to happen... so I'm forced to sell this junk on craigslist since I do not have the box to return. Installation is a breeze but you have to activate it in order for it to turn on... it does not advise you to do so ahead of time. Learn from my mistake... Do yourself a favor and buy a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Spurbeck

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a Pain in the Ass
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's a good treadmill. I don't know. Mine came with missing parts, and getting any sort of customer support has been impossible. Get this treadmill if you want a surprise DIY project, and enjoy spending more time and money tracking down the parts you need to complete your new exercise equipment. DON'T get this treadmill if you just want a treadmill. There are better options for that.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Bonobo

customer_reviews.title: Seems decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a decent treadmill for the money. Assembly is easy, would have preferred not dealing with the sub issue to start even with a work around. I have put in a warranty issue because the wiring harness did have 1 disconnected wire which prevented the belt from moving which I hope I can get a replacement for instead of relying on electrical tape holding it in place. Just glad I went through testing it before I tucking the harness in. *update* Customer service got me a new harness sent out without issue and covered by warranty, received it within a week and now works 100% with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Justus

customer_reviews.title: Good treadmill for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to move around. No problem putting it together. The belt does seem to drag some. I am about 190 lbs 5'4" it's ok when you speed up a bit. Could just need adjusting but I don't know how
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Mayo

customer_reviews.title: You are
customer_reviews.text: I love my machine but got absolutely no instructions on how to program my workouts. I called the help number twice and got disconnected both times. I don’t like that I have to have the blue tooth on. Why can’t I just turn it on and go! I was forced to buy the program for the blue tooth! I don’t think I would recommend it. NOT user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Stella Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is a disgrace.
customer_reviews.text: Poor manufacturing, poor quality, box looked like it had been dragged down the street. Plastic broken screws stripped, Amazon strikes again with selling garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Tips
customer_reviews.text: I really want to add some tips here. Assembly —- it’s a hell unless you try it logically. Especially fixing the base to the upright as trying to fix lower screw, upper screw did not fit in Bcz of width problem. Solution — loosen the bold net which already in the upright on the both the ends — see the pic attached. This will adjust the size and you can fix the base to the upright. Activation —- you don’t need to activate going to if it, fix the red key in place and click the rest button at the bottom and hold the Bluetooth icon for 38 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Meenu

customer_reviews.title: Overall good machine but there is a hidden detail
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: we read the details but no where does it say that to active the treadmill after assembly, you MUST subscribe to iFit. A quick Google search will help you overcome that issue if you buy this machine. Otherwise it's a great treadmill for the price. Feels pretty stable and assembly wasn't difficult. It is fairly compact and easy to move once folded up. I would recommend for a budget alternative for indoor running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you can get it together.
customer_reviews.text: Good luck putting this sucker together. It took two people twisting and pushing to get the holes to line up to screw the frame together. However, once we got that accomplished the machine seems to be working fine. I just walk, I don’t run on it. We will see how long it holds up. I don’t use the Bluetooth feature. It’s just a way to hook you into a subscription service with Fir Bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Music

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: It is a 300 treadmill so it is what it is... however, I am impressed so far! I set it up next to my other treadmill and use it for my dog to walk on next to me while I work out. It runs about 2.5 miles a day in the winter months and so far is holding up great and seems like will go for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and quiet treadmill
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill wasn't too difficult to assemble. It's very sturdy and the lock that holds up the treadmill is very strong. The device isn't that loud and is normal for any comparable home treadmill. The price was reasonable and It's also easy to move around the room when it's not in use. I enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: The base was pretty difficult to put together, it would be easier with two people. The screw holes wouldn’t line up so i had to put a lot of pressure on the leg for it to line up with the hole. You’ll need a phillips head screwdriver (+), which wasn’t included in the hardware. The manual says you’ll need to subscribe to ifit to get it start. To bypass that just press the bluetooth button until the screen changes and it’ll work. I haven’t used it yet but i wanted to share the assembly and start up. Also the box is very heavy, you’ll probably need two people to move it around without struggling, I sure did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need a enter your CC to use the treadmilll
customer_reviews.text: You have to enter a CC number number to activate the treadmill. The first 30 days are free but you have to cancel. It is not possible to plug in the machine and use it without the CC activation. Had I known this I would not have purchased it. The treadmill itself is ok for the money. The CC requirement is frustrating and maddening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out at home...
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill arrived the day before it was expected. It was fairly easy to assemble with the allen wrench that's included and your own Phillips screw driver. Folds up to save space when storing. I was able to bypass using the phone app by using the instructions provided by other reviewers. Great buy for working out at home!
customer_reviews.author: Keiangela

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup but Awkward Taking It Up The Stairs
customer_reviews.text: I love my Weslo Cadence 5.9i Treadmill!!! I dislike the fact that it does not have a screen light. It’s extremely difficult to see the time, distance, calories burn, information, etc. It took my 57 year old sister (who had her Weslo Cadence 5.9 treadmill for 4 years!) to assemble it in 30 minutes! Keep in mind my sister and our 55 year friend brought it up the stairs to the 3rd floor of my house!!!😳 I made the spot for it😄!
customer_reviews.author: Zonnytta M V Bolton

customer_reviews.title: A good entry level treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed. It’s a solid treadmill for the money. Activation (enabling the treadmill) is easy; at Hello, simply hold down the Bluetooth button for roughly 20 seconds and it comes alive For a low end treadmill, it’s a good buy for $300 I’m 5’11”, 245 lbs and it’s plenty long enough Trust me, buy it
customer_reviews.author: D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago and we put it together but if you start to run on it it slides like it's slippery so you have to hold on to the sides when you run I would not recommend this product to anybody it feels dangerous. I thought maybe after a year it would start to work but it still the same.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Do all treadmills seem to have in accurate distance recordings.
customer_reviews.text: Works great... I have run 1/2 marathons averaging 6 minute miles. It takes me 31 minutes to do 2 miles. That's switching back from 4.0 to 5.0 speeds. But hey it's a workout. Nothing real bad to say. Opening an account is kinda a pain to get it to turn on. But we'll worth the money.o
customer_reviews.author: kurt

customer_reviews.title: Finally got it working! The “hello problem” resolved
customer_reviews.text: Although I was initially very disappointed by not being able to reach a live real person, finally, after a couple of hours, I was finally able to reach customer service. It turned to to be a simple fixed not mentioned in the manual. (Hold Bluetooth button for 20 secs) My treadmill is up and running working fine so far. I’m a big guy 6’3” 240lbs and Holds me well jogging.
customer_reviews.author: youngrev121

customer_reviews.title: Good treadmill so far
customer_reviews.text: So far working good, assembled it all by myself and i’m a woman. I am missing one of the 4 screws from the bottom of the treadmill. Thinking I should message them and see if they can send me that screw.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Belt won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: I finally figured out if you hold the "Bluetooth" button down for 30 seconds the treadmill will work. You do not have to activate ifit and pay monthly. The manual and a sticker on the treadmill state you must activate ifit to get the treadmill to work. All you have to do is hold down the Bluetooth button for 30 seconds and the treadmill works great. I feel sorry for those who activate and pay $15.00 a month thinking this is the only way to get the treadmill to work. If you want the ifit features than go for it - I did not want them.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda S.

customer_reviews.title: Runs well but is kind of loud
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased so I could continue to do cardio as all gyms are closed (Corona) The treadmill is a little narrow for me I always hit my right knuckles on the right bar all the time. My main complaint is the noise it's louder then I expected, but all in all I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cmerkey

customer_reviews.title: This is a great machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine for the price! I put it together by myself in two hours- would be a lot quicker with two people lol :) ( the only thing I can't install is the lock that holds up the machine in " folding position" because the screws don't fit ) a trip to Home Depot will remedy that. It is sturdy, and works well. I am very happy with it and use it for running and walking.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this over the weekend and it was pretty easy to put together. My wife and I have been using it and it works great. Not that loud either. YOU DO NOT NEED A SUBSCRIPTION TO ACTIVATE THE TREADMILL. JUST HOLD DOWN THE BLUETOOTH BUTTON FOR 10-15 SECONDS AND IT WILL ACTIVATE. I'll provide another update in couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Mine has yet to come on
customer_reviews.text: Came in weeks ago, does not come on. Called Weslo, they sent me a new monitor. No effect. They sent me a new motor controller. Now I am getting something on the monitor but it still does not come on. Now they are going to send me a new wire of some kind. Not much hope of success.
customer_reviews.author: William White

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. I ordered this treadmill and it arrived broken. Of course it took me a minute to put together and by the time I did... it was out of warranty. I basically have a $300 pile of rubbish in my workout room unless I want to pay to have the broken thing fixed. Save your money and go with a reputable brand. It took forever to assemble because certain bolts were over tightened from the original settings and it took my husband and I un-assembling the parts that came assembled and putting them together again to get it to work. Oh, and then of course it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Burge

customer_reviews.title: Horrible to assemble! Wrong screws!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to assemble! First of, they packaged the wrong screws! Screws are bigger then the hole! Second, the console circular hole does not match up with the rectangular hole on the bars! They have new screws, but did not update the manual nor made the holes bigger for the screws to go in. Spent almost 2 hours in total trying to get parts. You have to be registered to have any questions answered! Now I have a partially assemble treadmill in my living taking up all the space until the screws arrive. I would hate to unassembled the first half when it was so much work to get it up the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa H.

customer_reviews.title: Only for walking.
customer_reviews.text: Noisy. Only for walking. Don't even try to jog on this thing. Paper thin belt. Buy a better unit used or jump up to $600. If you are a senior and only want to walk, and can put it together it might be ok. Need to get past the Bluetooth interface.
customer_reviews.author: Th577

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I had no issues putting it together myself (5’2”). You do not have sign up for iFit even though it tells you that you have to. When you turn it on (after putting the key in), simply hold the Bluetooth button for about 20-30 seconds. It clears it!
customer_reviews.author: Masinsmom

customer_reviews.title: Decent treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 2 days early but delivery person left it at my door WITHOUT knocking! I was home all day so would have heard if they had. Box was torn open but treadmill seemed undamaged. Assembly took about 30 minutes but it started up and ran smoothly from the get-go. I like it so far but really don't like how it was handled by the shipping/delivery person.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: more than i expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: i've use the treadmill several times now and it does exactly what it says. i think the digital info such as distance etc. may be off a little but most are. if your looking for a treadmill to walk or jog on and don't care about all the bells and whistles this is the one for you. dollar for dollar a great value.
customer_reviews.author: til

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 stars. Great treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product in June. I was skeptical to buy at first because many reviews said this was not good for running. Well they were wrong, I get a good sweat out of this thing-running to the point where I have to slow it down because I can’t keep up haha. It’s a great treadmill if you just want to be able to run in your home. I’d recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amberrrrrrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Expensive subscription required
customer_reviews.text: I assembled it. One bolt did not fit. I rearranged them to make them fit. I don't want ifit. I unenrolled. They said they'd unenroll me on 9-15. They turned off my machine immediately. I expectee to use my machine without the service. No one made me aware the machine would be disabled without additional payments. The reviews made clear no subscription was necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy
customer_reviews.text: You do have to activate via their app which requires a trial but can use after that without it. So hopefully after the trial I’m not charged to use this. Other than technology interference, it works wonderfully. Multiple people use it and the belt handles high weight.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: RUN
customer_reviews.text: This product is the biggest piece of garbage I have ever seen in my life. You cannot use the product unless you unlock it via the website and an activation through a subscription. Fortunately there is a way to accomplish this, but nowhere is it explained in the manual. Thanks to a YouTuber I figured out how to override it. The belt is absolute garbage too, and it just feels flimsy. Overall I shouldn't have been cheap and will never buy anything from Wesco again. If you see this product RUN (and if you can't run buy a different treadmil that will help you do so)
customer_reviews.author: Christian Clapp

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife happy life
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fact it was really easy to assemble and it works really great. I hate the app to track your workout and the website is terrible. In summary my wife is really happy to have this treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: How to activate if says “HELLO”
customer_reviews.text: Like- Good price. Easy to assemble. Dislike- The belt is a little finicky at 6mph or greater, and slips a bit with some steps. Very alarming when you’re running. FYI- To activate, if it just says hello, hold the Bluetooth button for 20sec. while it all cycles through. It’s not written down anywhere, I had to call to find that out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I work long hours and by the end of the day, am just ready to retire to my room. I bought the threadmill to fix my excuse for not working out. I had to hire someone to assemble it but am sure it would be easy for others. So far it works fine. I will have to wait to see how long it will work. I like it though!
customer_reviews.author: kaye

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was really hard for a 69 year old woman. It wouldn’t start until I registered with Fitbit for $180.00. Used it the first time ok, second time I started it up, it squeezed. Do you sell the oil?, I shouldn’t have to buy it so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hold bluetooth button for 30 seconds!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I took off one star because I was not able to start the machine. No where in the manual it says that to start to display and run the machine we have hold the bluetooth button for 30 seconds. I had to look online and got to know this from a youtube video comment!! After wasting hours. I thought I had a defective machine.
customer_reviews.author: A Akhtar

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this thing only has 3 stars. Should be 4 at the least. Product was relatively easy to assemble (took a few of us, but simple nonetheless), and you could essentially be brainless and still figure out how to get it up and running. iFit workouts are legit. Treadmill works marvelously. At the end of the workout, my body barely registers that this isn’t a nordictrack. I feel sweaty, satisfied, and accomplished. Thanks guys 😊
customer_reviews.author: Steph Proctor

customer_reviews.title: No instruction manual or tools...seriously??
customer_reviews.text: In 2020 how is it possible to ship something without the components required to put this thing together?...it is literally blowing my mind. I purchased from the seller which is WESLO and I have NO screws, NO instruction manual, and NO emergency stop switch...I only have the handle bars, the display unit and the treadmill itself. I need this fixed like ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin law

customer_reviews.title: very neat
customer_reviews.text: A very efficient machine...just what i needed for my bedroom...after all, i dont have a Gym..its perfect size for the bedroom. the reason i give it 3 stars is because i received it cracked. The plastic boundary at the front of the belt was visibly split. I'm not sure if this was boxed and sent like this or it happened during the shipping and handling...but i was quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin B.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wiring = non functional motor
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as many other folks. Unit powers on just fine, display (with almost non existent contrast at my 6ft viewing angle) functional, BUT, belt doesn’t turn. Faulty upright wire that connects the console to the micro controller turns this into a massive paper weight. I’ve heard these are okay treadmills when they work. Quality control is clearly an issue based on both the reviews and our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts from the get go
customer_reviews.text: When my treadmill arrived, the handrails were missing from the box. When I contacted Weslo, they said the handrails were on back order & had no idea when they would be in stock. Obviously, they knew this when they sent the treadmill. I couldn't fully assemble it for 4 weeks, which was when I finally received the handrails. It's now together and love it, but I'm still missing the part that allows the treadmill to be folded & held in place. I would rather have waited for the treadmill than to have it arrive, missing parts & not able to use.
customer_reviews.author: Patty B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: It's actually better than I had expected. Works great! There is some confusion on how to get the machine in manual mode if you don't want a monthly fee from ifit and you DO NOT have to sign up with them at all. Turn the power off and back on. Press and hold the Bluetooth button on the right for 30 seconds and the machine will go in manual mode. Attaching the legs to the front of the machine was a challenge. It doesn't line up exactly right and it takes 2 people to do that part. Otherwise it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: SherryBabi

customer_reviews.title: very Good product, easy to use, solid.
customer_reviews.text: very Good product, easy to use, solid and strong - I wish the LCD display has back-lit - Belt seems not hard enough and getting more softer.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this treadmill is easy to set up. Also easy to fold up after workout. Treadmill works very well. Not a lot of noise. I use it 3 times a week to walk and have not had any problems with it's performance at all. Great in a limited space environment. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ladie88

customer_reviews.title: It’s everything it claims to be!
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill works exactly how it was described and what the reviews said! My 5 stars is also for Mark the gentleman who came and set it up for me! He went above and beyond. He was great and well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: L. Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Chipped, broken, bent but works great!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived within 24 hrs which is great! It gave me a hard time to put together, but I was done within about an hour. It came chipped (only the paint) and bent a bit (where the paint chipped) and the plastic cover on the bottom is cracked but these issues do not affect the machine. It works great and relatively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Mariann

product_meta.title: Weslo Cadence G 5.9i Cadence Folding Treadmill, Easy Assembly with Bluetooth
product_meta.description:
Experience superior fitness at your own speed with the Weslo cadence G 5.9I Treadmill. With fit coach technology, the Weslo cadence G 5.9I Treadmill makes it simple to get started on your fitness path. Simply pair your tablet with the built-in fit coach system for access to Google maps workouts, comprehensive tracking, and top trainer workouts. The manual adjustable incline helps you target specific muscles. And the convenient Space Saver design allows you to fold up your machine out of the way when it's not in use. Start your fitness journey with confidence with the Weslo cadence G 5.9I Treadmill. 

*Continuous Horsepower ("CHP") is a term used in the treadmill industry for consumer comparison purposes. The CHP rating is measured in laboratory testing using a dynamometer, which measures the mechanical power of the motor. The CHP rating does not denote the operational horsepower of the treadmill in ordinary household use. In ordinary household use, the motor does not operate at the horsepower shown.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 55.5” H x 29” W x 64.5” D | Folded Dimensions: 60” H x 29” D | Belt: 16" W x 50 D

Activation required: Go to ifit.com/activate to redeem your 1 month iFit membership and activate your equipment or simply press and hold the Bluetooth button for 25 secs while the machine is turned on to manually activate it
If you want to bypass iFit activation press and hold the Bluetooth button for approximately 30 seconds while the machine is turned on.
Space saver design: Simply fold your machine’s treadmill deck up when you are done working out in 1 easy step
Integrated tablet holder: Keeps your tablet secure and conveniently close
Connect via smartphone to your equipment

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
